Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which quadrant is biased towards red based on the four rounds of this game. Let me break it down step by step.

Round 3: Cues available are A and C. I chose A and saw GREEN.
Round 4: Only cue A is available. I need to choose A based on previous observations.

The setup is that each round, one quadrant has a 90% chance of one color and 10% the other, while the other quadrants have 50-50 distribution. So, each quadrant is either biased or balanced.

In each round, I can choose one of the available cues, and based on the color I see, I can infer something about that quadrant. The key is to figure out which quadrant is the one that's biased.
